SimulationRobot module¶

class SimulationRobot.SimulationRobot(robot_params)¶

Class describing a robot in SimulationWorld

control_update(dt, world=None)¶

Updates the robot’s velocity and rotation according to the alogorithm set in the robot_params dict

Parameters:
  • dt (float) – The time difference since the last control update
  • world (SimulationWorld) – The world this robot exists within. Used to detect other objects in the world such as other robots and barriers
get_neighbours(distance_matrix)¶

Returns the robot’s neighbours via their robot_index

Nebighbourhood params are dictated by neighbourhood_mode, neighbourhood_size and neighbourhood_distance in robot_params

Parameters:distance_matrix (np.array) – NxN array for a world with N robots in it. Represents the distance between every robot in the array
Returns:Neighbour indexes
Return type:list
movement_update(dt)¶

Updates the robots position based on its current position and velocity

Parameters:dt (float) – The time difference since the last movement update
on_sim_start()¶

Initialises the robot depending on the alogorithm set in the robot_params dict

Executed during the init position log of the SimulationWorld class, so should be executed just before the first time step

SimulationRobot.sample_distro(distro_tuple)¶

Samples a certain probability distrobution function (PDF) described by a tuple of parameters

Parameters:distro_tuple (tuple (distrobution_name, arg1,arg2...)) – The PDF to sample from
Returns:the number generated from the PDF
Return type:float
